channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Many drains on left hand side going down the hill not flat, feels like going in pot holes, 31st January
item.description:
Along the left hand side going all the way down the hill, the drains are not level and it's like driving into really bad pot holes. The majority are like this and you can't avoid them as the road isn't wide enough.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing audible sound too loud/soft problem, 31st January
item.description:

item.title: Build up of Soil/Grass and a fly tipped piece of concrete need removing, along the wall, at the end of Denbigh Road, it is part of the Road, 31st January
item.description:
This has been building up, over a number years

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Denbigh Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain cover sudden into ground, 31st January
item.description:
The drain on the south bound road near the house to the right is now sunken and causing a large pothole effect when driven over, it will give way soon enough. Constant further damage due to large heavy goods vehicles driving over it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate is damaged/missing/locked problem, 31st January
item.description:
Gate has become broken over time as it is in heavy use and is now not working properly. Isn't closing securely and has a loose post - cattle kept in field can get through it.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sustained damage problem, 31st January
item.description:
email rec 24/01/2024 - Hi We have an issue in Hucclecote where two bollards, on a pavement, are positioned too far apart enabling drivers to park on the pavement (between the gaps). This is becoming quite persistent (see attached photo). Would it be possible to either reposition them or install an additional one? The location is Foxwell Drive (just off Hillview Road). Some bollards a few yards away were badly damaged in a car accident over the weekend and will need to be replaced. Would it be possible to do both jobs at the same time? Regards
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Problem remains i.e. large drop in the road surface, 31st January
item.description:
Good morning. You have reported this issue as 'fixed.' It most certainly is not. As far as I can tell while driving, there has been no change or fix made to the road and yet it has been reported as fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pittville Crescent Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Poor Street cleaning Usrn: 40101176 hucclecote road junction with Hucclecote footpath 36 usrn 40102389, 30th January
item.description:
The junction of West End Lane with Hucclecote Road is a tarmaced footpath recorded as hucclecote footpath 36. It is poorly cleaned with high levels of detritus, decaying leaves etc and the area is considered to have fallen to grade D (see set C on page 17 of the litter code) and needs to be brought up to grade A as set out in the litter code.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
